bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with bi yuan 鼻淵 , nasal deep-source [outflow]. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry zao jia 皂莢 quoting Ru men shi qin 儒門事親 15 Recipe Entry nao xuan fang 腦宣方 , “Recipe for brain spread”, writes: 腦宣不止 , “Unending brain spread ”. This may be a misinterpreted disease term. Pu ji fang 普濟方 53 quoting this recipe writes: 腦宣方，治耳聾 , “Brain spread recipe cures deafness”. Ru men shi qin 儒門事親 Recipe Entry nao xuan fang 腦宣方 , “Brain spread recipe”, does not mention an ailment as a therapeutic indication. However, the preceding recipe entry lists a “recipe to cure deafness”, and the following entry lists “a recipe to cure ear diminution”. Hence it may well be that the author of Pu ji fang 普濟方 mistook the desired effect of “causing the brain to spread (and thereby to cure deafness, etc.)” as the ailment to be cured by this recipe.
